gurmukhi: qbY dyv Dwey ] sBo sIs inAwey ]
transliteration: Tabai Dev Dhaae|| Sabho Soos Niaae||
translation: Then the gods ran towards the goddess; with bowed heads.

gurmukhi: sumn Dwr brKy ] sBY swD hrKy ]6]
transliteration: Souman Dhaar Barkhe|| Sabhai Saadh Barkhe||6||
translation: The flowers were showered; and all the saints (hods) were pleased.6.

gurmukhi: krI dyib Arcw ] bHm byd crcw ]
transliteration: Daroo Deh(i) Archaa|| Brahm Bed Charchaa||
translation: The goddess was worshipped; with the recitation of Vesdas manifested by Brahma.

gurmukhi: jbY pwie lwgy ] qbY sog Bwgy ]7]
transliteration: Jabai Paae Laage|| Tabai Sog Bhaage||7||
translation: When they fell at the feet of the goddess; all their sufferings ended.7.
They made their supplication, and pleased the goddess;

gurmukhi: sBY ssqR DwrI ] krI isMG suAwrI ]8]
transliteration: Sabhai Sastra Dhdaroo|| Daroo Singh Sudaroo||8||
translation: Who wore all her weapons, and mounted the lion.8.

gurmukhi: suxo deIq rwjM ] sijE ju`D swjM ]9]
transliteration: Souno Daoot Raajan|| Sajio Juddh Saajan||9||
translation: The sounds was heard by the demon-king, who made preparations for the war.9.
The demon-king marched forward and appointed four generals;
One was Chamar, the second was Chichhur, both brave and persistent.10.
The third was the brave biralachh, they were all mighty warriors and most tenacious.

gurmukhi: bfy ieKu DwrI ] Gtw jwn kwrI ]11]
transliteration: Bade Ikh(u) Dhdaroo|| Ghataa Jaan Kdaroo||11||
translation: They were great archers and marched forward like dark clouds.11.

gurmukhi: bwx ijqy rwCsin imil Cwfq Bey Apwr ]
transliteration: Baan Jite Raachhasan(i) Mil(i) Chhaadat Bhae Apaar||
translation: The arrows showered by all the demons together in great numbers,
